title: a-hr/lexogen pipeline parameters
a-hr/lexogen_pipeline
description: A pipeline to demultiplex, map, deduplicate and count target RNA sequences

csv_dir.help_text: Path to the directory where fiveprime.csv, three prime.csv and annotations.saf are located.

fastq_dir.help_text: Path to the directory containing the FASTQ files (either gzipped or not) to be used.

index_dir.help_text: Directory containing the reference STAR genome if already created. If not, the index created by the pipeline could be saved here.
Path to the directory where fiveprime.csv, three prime.csv and annotations.saf are located.

fastq_dir.help_text: Path to the directory containing the FASTQ files (either gzipped or not) to be used.

index_dir.help_text: Directory containing the reference STAR genome if already created. If not, the index created by the pipeline could be saved here.

suffix.help_text: Common pattern to detect both pair-end files, without the 1 and 2. For example: file_R01; file_R02 --> suffix = _R0

output_dir.help_text: Path to the directory that will contain the output tables, BAMs, QC reports and logs.
Path to the directory that will contain the output tables, BAMs, QC reports and logs.

get_bams.description: whether to output aligned BAMs or not
get_bams.help_text: Useful to visualize individual samples with IGV to explore the reads.
Useful to visualize individual samples with IGV to explore the reads.

save_index.description: whether to save the generated index to the index_dir path

create_index.description: whether to create the STAR index or not
create_index.help_text: Not necessary to create one if an index is already available (link it with index_dir parameter).

ref_gen.help_text: A directory containing the reference FASTA and GTF annotations to create the STAR index.
A directory containing the reference FASTA and GTF annotations to create the STAR index.

sharedMemory.description: False when running on a cluster, True else.
sharedMemory.help_text: Enables the use of shared memory to optimize RAM usage of STAR by sharing the reference index across parallel processes. HPC clusters usually do not allow its use.
